prompt: Explain the role of data normalization in relational database design.

criteria.name: Understanding of Data Normalization
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of normalization principles and forms.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains normalization, its goals, and describes 1NF, 2NF, 3NF (or higher) with examples.
performance_descriptors.good: Accurately describes normalization and at least two normal forms.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of normalization.

criteria.name: Importance in Database Design
criteria.description: Explains how normalization improves relational database structure.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully links normalization to data consistency, elimination of redundancy, and efficient design.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes reduction of redundancy and better structure.

criteria.name: Use of Examples
criteria.description: Uses relevant examples to illustrate normalization concepts.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Multiple, relevant examples with clear explanations.
performance_descriptors.good: At least one clear example provided.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents answer in a logical, academic style.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly organized, formal, and clear response.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear structure and mostly formal style.

key_points: Explains normalization and its main goals
Links normalization to reduced redundancy and improved integrity
llm_questions: What are the different normal forms (1NF, 2NF, 3NF)?
Why is normalization important in database design?
Can you provide examples of normalization?
How does normalization improve data consistency?
